conditions.name: Moderate ALT Elevation
conditions.description: Criteria for dose interruption due to liver enzyme elevation.

conditions.name: Severe ALT Elevation
conditions.description: Criteria for permanent discontinuation due to liver enzyme elevation.

conditions.name: Low Hemoglobin
conditions.description: Criteria for dose reduction due to low hemoglobin.

conditions.name: Low Platelets
conditions.description: Criteria for dose reduction due to low platelets.

conditions.name: Neutrophil Decrease
conditions.description: Criteria for dose reduction due to significant neutrophil decrease.
conditions.text: Neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline and below reference range at baseline

conditions.name: Hy's Law Criteria
conditions.description: Criteria for dose interruption due to potential liver injury.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 × ULN accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN

conditions.name: Neurologic Worsening
conditions.description: Criteria for potential dose modification based on neurologic assessment.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.description: Criteria for potential dose modification based on psychiatric assessment.
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis.

conditions.name: Acceptable Safety for Dose Escalation
conditions.description: Safety Review Committee must review safety data through Day 23 before dose escalation.
conditions.text: Review of available safety data through Day 23 by the Safety Review Committee (SRC) shows no safety concerns precluding dose increase.

conditions.name: Discontinuation Criteria
conditions.description: General criteria for discontinuing study intervention.
conditions.text: Serious hypersensitivity reaction; Severe uncontrolled infection; Use of disallowed medication; Pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

transitionRules.name: Dose Escalation to 30mg
transitionRules.text: On Day 29, increase dose from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day, following SRC review of safety data through Day 23.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Moderate ALT Elevation
transitionRules.text: Temporary interruption of dosing if ALT > 3 × ULN and ≤ 5 × ULN.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Severe ALT Elevation
transitionRules.text: Permanently discontinue study intervention if ALT > 5 × ULN.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Hematologic Abnormality
transitionRules.text: Reduce dose to previous dose level or to 15 mg QOD if Hemoglobin < 10 g/dL, Platelets < 100,000/mm3, or Neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Hy's Law Criteria
transitionRules.text: Temporary interruption of dosing if Bilirubin > 2 × ULN accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN.

transitionRules.name: Dose Modification for Neurologic/Psychiatric Worsening
transitionRules.text: Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification (interruption, increase or decrease) based on neurologic or psychiatric worsening.

transitionRules.name: Intervention Discontinuation for Safety/Compliance
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for: Serious hypersensitivity reaction; Severe uncontrolled infection; Use of disallowed medication; Pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities (SoA).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal of Consent
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discretionary Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Sponsor or Investigator Termination of Study/Site
scheduleTimelineExits.description: The study or a site may be closed early for reasons including failure to comply with protocol, inadequate recruitment, or discontinuation of study intervention development.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Escalation Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Safety Review Committee (SRC) reviews safety data through Day 23 to approve dose titration from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day on Day 29.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Ongoing Safety-Based Dose Modification
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: At any time, if a participant meets criteria for dose modification (e.g., elevated LFTs, hematologic abnormalities, neurologic/psychiatric worsening), the dose will be modified or interrupted as specified.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Ongoing Intervention Discontinuation Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: At any time, if a participant meets criteria for intervention discontinuation (e.g., severe ALT elevation, hypersensitivity, pregnancy), the study intervention will be permanently discontinued.
